OP

Early replies (first 3)

61896476

61896484
>>61896469
Don't care, at least I make money

61896500
>>61896484

Yeah, we know you don't care. That's why you're an NPC.

It's going to crash, though.

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61896528
>>61896469
there is nothing wrong with buying precious metals
there is something wrong, however, with thinking your metal is going to "end the federal reserve" or somehow replace the monetary system

61896556
>>61896528
>there is nothing wrong with buying precious metals

Precious metals are dead weight; stacking them is for people who are content to stay in place. Also known as NPCs.

61896560
>>61896469
stonk market always have been normiemaxxing, but PMs i don't get it, for years you called us nazi doomposting schitzos, but now we are normies??

61896569
>>61896560
no one ever called you that
you were always buying a boomer infomercial rocks

61896570
>>61896469
What is not NPC behaviour? Buying stinkies and going bankrupt?

61896601
>>61896570

Bitcoin and a brand new asset class designed to crush the bankers and defund the politicians, called crypto.

61896610
>>61896569
oh ok, sorry i must have been hallucinating for all these years, thx for correcting the record anon.

61896632
>>61896560

Turns out, you were right, but you were just being an NPC and following the crowd. If you were free thinking, you would know why Bitcoin is a better solution.

61896642
>>61896610
no problem, glad I'm here to help
jk I'm sure someone called that to you, but seriously my boomer parents watch Fox News 24/7 and there's like 10 ads from goldbugs about buying metals. I'm sure they're overcharging the fuck out of them, but I fail to see how it's such a threat to their system if they're so enthusiastic about selling it physically.

61896708
>>61896642
>but I fail to see how it's such a threat to their system if they're so enthusiastic about selling it physically.
You are correct, it's clearly not. No financial instrument will ever threaten (((them))) anyway, they literally master it. No, the only thing they fear can hardly be called an investment (at least for the ones involved) : it is few thousands determined goyim going full Luigi, but that's not happening anytime soon.

item.title: European funds for an american — 40 replies — 22.5/hr
item.content:encoded:
European funds for an american

Open thread • Replies: 40 • Updated: 2026-02-24 16:53 UTC

OP

I want to put 20% of my account in foreign, but not all foreign is created equal.

I predicted the rise in the polish economy. It's very simple, a homogenous white country free from communism is always going to become rich. A diverse country full of communists like Canada and South Africa is going to get worse and worse.

I also predicted that the real-estate market in Croatia would sky rocket due to whites fleeing countries like the UK. I was right.

So.... are there any good mutual/index funds that target the white regions of Europe, that an American can invest in? Is there a Balkans fund? A Baltic fund? Norway/Finland fund (not Sweden or Denmark)? I do not want to invest in the UK, France, Germany, or Spain.

Early replies (first 3)

61890485
>finland
>white

61890499
>please buy my bag
nein. Death to every communist, that includes every single member of a political party, everyone over 50, every bureaucrat and every single subsidized "private" which in europe is every company.

61890518
No fucking way those numbers on finland are right. I live in Helsinki and it’s like 25% brown.

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61891134
>>61890472
>a homogenous white country free from communism
not Sweden

61891154
>>61890855
I have friends who moved to Croatia. Reason? White flight from the UK. Highly productive middle class white people pouring out of one area and into another, means good things for one economy and bad things for the other. It's no different than watching the small cities that surround Akron, Cleveland, Chicago, Detroit, Oakland, Baltimore, etc... All get richer and richer and have better and better economies due to all of the whites in those cities pouring out into the surrounding areas.

You say it's not that simple, yet I've told people this will happen and for 30 years, I've been right. I watched the real estate market in Croatia skyrocket into the stratosphere. I've also made a lot of money on real-estate outside of Cleveland and Akron just by investing in the white flight destinations.

61891164
>>61890868
This is in fact, old data.

>>61891134
Yes. That's why I said funds that invest in Norway and Finland, but not Denmark and Sweden. I know Finland isn't really Nordic but they're next door.

61891236
>>61891154
That's fine but from the average person's perspective you can't understand the bigger economic picture and appreciate the vast differences in market size and capital flows.
Life for average people may be more or less similar in Croatia and England but the English stock exchange is in another universe compared to these small economies.
As I said, I'm an American living in Latvia. My life is better in Latvia. I'm just a normal guy. The top 1% and .01% would see things quite differently. Where does one park $100,000,000 in the Baltics?
Answer: you don't. And downstream from that is YOU don't get to invest $50,000 in an Estonia market ETF either. These are frontier markets not even as developed as Brazil or India.

61891243
>>61891003
Euskadi

61891374
>>61891236
I think real-estate, and downstream from that medical services, are pretty simple by and large because they're mostly just a matter of predicting the migration patterns of middle class white people, while avoiding the political behavior of lumpenprole voters. At a bare minimum investing in medical services and realestate are a safe bet in any communist free white flight destination.

Question then becomes, what financial products are available to me that resemble that in any way.

There's a fund called NHCBHFFT that invests in real estate in estonia, for example.

61891396
>>61890472
>I do not want to invest in the UK
FTSE100 has been outperforming the S&P500 for a while now but okay

61891622
>>61891396
I want a stock that will perform well long term, the UK, like Canada and South Africa, has not future unless it claws it's way back from Weimar conditions. The massive white flight that has already taken place and has been accelerating, looks exactly how things looked for Detroit, Chicago, Oakland, Baltimore, etc...

Ghettofication is an economy killer. Because people ignore it and it makes people irrational, that is the area an investor can exploit.

61892062
>>61890472
Brown migration is stagnating across Europe and so is the birthrate of migrants of the 2nd/3rd generation. The number of migrants are not big enough to not be outbred in the long run.

61892245
>>61890472
This is probably based on early 90s data when Bulgaria was full of gypsies, France was full of North Africans, but the rest of the countries were fine.
Now Bulgarian gypsies are also abroad and the roles are reversed, lol (except for France, that's only getting worse).

61892365
>>61892062
sounds like copium

61892695
>>61892062
White flight is the real economy killer. Again, look at all the places already mentioned. Niggers in america don't have exceptional birthrates but once they're 20% of a city everyone else runs away. Same as true for states and countries. Most nigger cities in America have half the population they had the in 60s. Akron and Cleveland have lost about half of their population due to white flight.

61892982
>>61890855
This.
I’m polish and I can explain a bit just to give a gist.
Poland’s “capitalist” period started in ‘89 so to this day the biggest companies included in WIG20 are completely controlled by National Treasury. So 8 of them constitute about 55% of the index.
So mind you by loading up on indexes you’re not really buying innovation rather iron clad businesses that aren’t really growth oriented.
Let’ take an example of searching for growth sectors like everyone talks about polish developers so it would be safe to assume that IT stuff has growth potential.
And here the biggest IT company is CD project which makes fucking games a dying industry that will be killed by small teams with ai making indie games.
Rest of well known IT firms are privately owned or controlled by ventures.
It’s hard to really find good stuff I personally think you should search for companies making tangible products or services example solar panels, beauty sector, pharma.
We’ve got a lot of ecomerce, construction, pharma/cosmetics, news outlets. Not really innovative stuff.

I mean I wish it was different but really if someone made something meaningful here he would be molested to death by venture capital like CVC Capital Partners and eventually cave in take cash run and live a beautiful trad life in Bielsko Biała.

61893067
>>61892982
Cont.
So to comparing to the US, Poland is a polar opposite.
In the US Capital lobbies politics. In Poland the only people who can lobby are foreign players and people with political power. And this political power has more influence on the stock market while in the US stock market and capital makes politics.
The end communist era ripples through Poland up to this day. The people responsible for the transition made themselves very powerful and control the capital to this day. The good news it that their descendants are retarded beyond comprehension and will be unable to maintain power.

61895024
>>61892695
They will just flee from one city to another, Germans aren't moving from Germany to go to fucking Poopland lol

61895226
>>61890472
>Balkans
ha haha hahahahahahaha

61895249
>>61893067
That doesn't sound like good news

61895250
>>61890472
South Korea, Japan and Brazil.
Lmao if you want to put it into Europe.

61895308
>>61890472
Check how cucked European stocks are with regards to taxes.
The only European stocks i would invest in are stocks listed in London Stock Exchange for this reason.

61895312
>>61895226
The Balkans are probably majority white now, because all of the gyppos are here in Finland and other Nordic countries.

61895890
>>61890472
Look into EU military companies. Saab, Rheinmetall etc. have had huge growth and are still on the rise.
Also whatever alternative renewables there are. (Things like synthetic fuels and deep geothermal)
Also companies that are processing rare earths and minerals. It is expected that the Europeans will start to extract those resources soon. The usual structure is that companies from outside the EU can mine, but are contractually obligated to sell most of the resources to companies inside of the Union for processing.

Also tech is fine. Plenty of EU countries are turning their backs towards US tech. Many government offices are currently swapping to different software, mostly open source. Expect EU companies to code scaleable European solutions soon.

61895901

item.title: Mac minis are the new ASIC miners — 42 replies — 16.1/hr
item.content:encoded:
Mac minis are the new ASIC miners

Open thread • Replies: 42 • Updated: 2026-02-24 16:03 UTC

OP

Mac minis are like the ASIC miners except they do actual work instead of mining bitcoin for no reason.

Early replies (first 3)

61893585
>>61893434

61893611
>>61893585

61893612
>>61893611

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61894324
There’s a few anecdotal reports of people making money with ai which is driving fomo, but in reality nobody is making money running these bots

61894795
You cant make money with AI.
AI and mac mini is a Rube GoldBERG machine to make unsellable apps like calenders and Diaries

61895001
>>61893585
Its like those Chinese phone farms, only with macs

61895139
>>61893434
>Mac Mini
these POS are not designed for this
literal ashtrays shortly.

61895152
they are not actually hosting models on those minis lmao, its set up solely so that openclaw doesn't disintegrate the OS of your main daily driver computer which often happens

61895163
>>61894122
>The latest apple minis are 5x faster than equivalent costing PCs at running AI
Pure bullshit and you don't know shit about technology.

The unified memory bandwith is nice but you only get real benefits with something like M3 Ultra and even then, a properly set up PC inference workstation with real GPU's will beat the macs token times by a fair margin

The problem is with current RAM prices and how scarce GPU's with decent VRAM are the Mac is actually a viable alternative to putting a rig together, even if it gets a bit less tokens per second.

61895191
What does AI actually do?

61895196
>>61895191
Create asset bubbles.

61895198
>>61895191

61895251
>>61895191
What do You actually do?

This message was written by:
50 macs

61895338
>>61893611
imagine the smell

61895344
>>61895338
jej is make me laugh

61895377
>>61893611
minus the shitting?

61895732
>>61895163
>even then, a properly set up PC inference workstation with real GPU's will beat the macs token times by a fair margin
Not at the same price

61895740
>>61895377
Plus they can work 24 hours a day

>>61895338
Apple shouldn't actually produce smells because it's considered a premium product

61895757
>>61895191
Glorified googling program.

I’ve tried to use AI to diagnose some tricky health issues I’ve had and while it did help at first, I’m pretty sure it eventually tried to kill me.

61895762
>>61895732
If it was 'the same price' people would choose the faster option, aka notMac. The problem with the cheap option here being - again - you can cool GPUs and they are somewhat designed to be ran at high temps for extended periods. Mac Minis weren't and aren't. And these retards are going to fry their Mactrash, abusing them 24/7 as retarded AI agents.

61895788
you really don't need a mac mini, old Lenovo Thinkcenters work perfectly fine and you get get a used one with 32GB of ram and 2 TB of disk space for like $200-300

I have been using a few with Unbuntu installed to run a bunch of agents on an isolated Vlan at home. (These things are honestly security risks, don't give them access to your home network or personal info)

61895820
>>61895757
chatgpt is useless now, its a glorified yes man. You can actually trick it into giving horrific advice. Which puts it at the level of a 32 year old life coach, nothing more. Gemini is a good tool if you can get a local unit to run, great for helping map and document trades. But nothing more than that, if you really needed something to bounce ideas off of it isn't that. But that is all you can expect out of it, a really good calculator. It's when people expect it to be a thinking breathing human is when problems arise

61895868
>>61895788
And what model can you on 32gb ram? Thinkcentres dont have dedicated gpu do they?

61895888
>>61895868
no one is running the actual model locally, this is for running the agent and all its tools, most people are running API calls off Openrouter

61895922
>>61895888
These ARE running local models, that's the entire point of using MacMinis and unified RAM. Whether the Minis will survive the experience, is another issue entirely.

61896004
>>61895757
Interesting.
Mine kept saying im trans. Kek!
> sadface.jpg

61896011
>>61894156
>>give the mac mini all of my personal info, financial data, passwords, internet browsing history etc.
It's a personal computer. It already has all of those things.

61896031
>>61895820
Yes that’s pretty much it. Although it did help me diagnose leaky gut issues and initially helped with some supplements, but then it started telling me to basically OD on magnesium and electrolytes.

61896090
>>61894238
Rent it to people that are scared of running it locally or too stupid to figure it out.
Stuff like this https://seafloor.bot/

61896126
Basically in the future everyone will have their own personal agentic AI, and these people are hosting them while its still hard to get it set up.
This isnt a sustainable business model tho, because its only a matter of time before soke big company like google starts doing it with infinitely more success because they actually have all the data from everyone, so the AI assistant will come out of factory already knowing you better than you know yourself.
But it will be profitable probably for a 1 or 2. I dont see this stuff getting released by a big company before its tested enough to ensure most of the nightmarish stories being reported about openclaw have a close to 0% chance of happening.

61896174
>>61893434
>they do actual work
how much money has your agent made?

61896193
>>61895922
No they aren't. They're just a bunch of iToddlers who can't into Raspberry Pi or Linux.

>>61896427

yes i do have pattern recognition and the pattern i see on every major cryptocurrency chart is a limp bull market that swept the previous bull market highs, or in many cases failed to even get close to them, is now rolling over, and with my pattern recognition i can deduce that the likely target is to at the very least sweep the previous bear market lows or go even lower to fill big imbalances in the chart.

bottom. signal.
